intro: Silene gallica var. lusitanica, commonly known as the Lusitanian campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Silene gallica var. lusitanica is often found in Mediterranean regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
